intro: Jaltomata tayabambae, commonly known as the Tayabamba bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Jaltomata tayabambae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
